title: 104_s226
content:
The "Chacoan Outliers Protection Act of 1995" amends Public Law 96-550 to include surrounding areas of the San Juan Basin. Thirty-nine outlying sites are designated as 'Chaco Culture Archeological Protection Sites', totaling approximately 14,372 acres. The Chacoan Outliers Protection Act of 1995 designates 39 outlying sites as 'Chaco Culture Archeological Protection Sites', totaling approximately 14,372 acres. Some of the sites include Allentown (380 acres), Andrews Ranch (950 acres), Bee Burrow (480 acres), Bisa'ani (131 acres), Casa del Rio (40 acres), Casamero (160 acres), Chimney Rock (3,160 acres), Coolidge (450 acres), Dalton Pass (135 acres), Dittert (480 acres), Great Bend (26 acres), and Greenlee Ruin (60 acres). The Chacoan Outliers Protection Act of 1995 designates various outlying sites as 'Chaco Culture Archeological Protection Sites', totaling approximately 14,372 acres. Some of the sites include Greenlee Ruin (60 acres), Grey Hill Spring (23 acres), Guadalupe (115 acres), Halfway House (40 acres), Haystack (565 acres), Hogback (453 acres), Indian Creek (100 acres), Jaquez (66 acres), Kin Nizhoni (726 acres), Lake Valley (30 acres), Manuelito-Atsee Nitsaa (60 acres), Manuelito-Kin Hochoi (116 acres), and Morris 41 (85 acres). It will also be provided to the offices of the Arizona and New Mexico State Historic Preservation Officers. SEC. 4. DEFINITION. Amends Section 503 of Public Law 96-550 to include a reference to the Secretary. 

SEC. 5. LAND ACQUISITIONS. Amends Section 504(c)(2) to allow the Secretary to protect archeological resources through land acquisition authority and cooperative agreements. 

SEC. 6. ASSISTANCE TO THE NAVAJO NATION. Section 506 of Public Law 96-550 is amended to provide assistance to the Navajo Nation in protecting and managing Chaco Culture Archeological Protection Sites through grants, contracts, or cooperative agreements. The assistance includes site planning, resource protection, interpretation, and other activities specified in the agreement. Assistance is provided to the Navajo Nation for the development of a facility serving visitors interested in the Chacoan Outlier Sites.
